item.title: Death Stranding 2: Complete Trophy Guide
item.description:
For players looking to experience everything Death Stranding 2: On the Beach has to offer, completing the Platinum trophy is the best way to go about it. With a total of 55 trophies – including the Platinum – Death Stranding 2 offers players a great mix of action, exploration, and more than a few secrets. Like the first game, players can complete the Platinum trophy in a single playthrough. In this guide, we'll show you how to do just that. Here is our complete guide to unlocking every trophy in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach .

Warning! Major Story Spoilers Ahead!!!

Be careful, as many of the episode titles and trophy descriptions contain major story spoilers for Death Stranding 2: On the Beach.

How to Unlock All Trophies in DS2

100% Trophy Completion:

Trophy Name

Trophy Type

Description

How to Unlock

Homo Liberans: The Savior of Humanity

Platinum

Obtain all Death Stranding 2 trophies.

Simply complete every other trophy on the list to unlock the Platinum trophy.

"Lou? Can You Hear Me? Can You See Me?"

Bronze

Complete Episode 1: Sam

Each of DS2 's Episode trophies will be awarded automatically upon completion.

"Time to Start a New Journey"

Bronze

Complete Episode 2: Lou

N/A

"Help Us Bring Australia Into The Network"

Bronze

Complete Episode 3: Drawbridge

N/A

"We'll Show the World the Hope in Your Rain"

Bronze

Complete Episode 4: Raindrops

N/A

"Did He Say Nirvana?"

Bronze

Complete Episode 5: Conflagration

N/A

"To Our Little Family"

Bronze

Complete Episode 6: Chrysalis

N/A

"Sam the Man–In the Dark About Everything"

Bronze

Complete Episode 7: Pod

N/A

"His Name is Neil. Neil Vana"

Bronze

Complete Episode 8: Deluge

N/A

"I Don't Break that Easily"

Bronze

Complete Episode 9: Puppets

N/A

"You Will Never, Ever Be Alone"

Bronze

Complete Episode 10: Isolation

N/A

"Keep Lou Safe..."

Bronze

Complete Episode 11: Quake

N/A

"To Help You Find the Strength to Carry On"

Bronze

Complete Episode 12: Fragile

N/A

"To Forsake Our Flesh and Our Freedom"

Bronze

Complete Episode 13: Die Hard

N/A

"We Have to Get Tomorrow Back"

Bronze

Complete Episode 14: Last Stranding

N/A

"I'll Always Be With You"

Bronze

Complete Episode 15: On the Beach

N/A

"Death Can't Tear Us Apart"

Bronze

Complete Episode 16: Tomorrow

N/A

Standard Porter

Bronze

Complete a Standard Order for the first time.

Standard Orders are one of two 'side-quest' types in DS2, along with Sub-Orders. This order type will unlock after Order 10 in Episode 3: Drawbridge. You'll only need to complete a single Standard Order to unlock this trophy.

Seasoned Porter

Gold

Complete 10 Deliveries, 10 Recoveries, 10 Elimination/Destruction standard orders with an S-rank in Casual difficulty or above.

Make sure to pay attention to the order type when at each terminal. It will tell you whether you are taking on a basic order, recovery, or elimination/destruction. For standard and recovery orders, make sure to keep the cargo from receiving any damage. For elimination/destruction orders, check to see how much damage Sam can take. Sam taking too much damage is the easiest way not to get an S-rank with these orders.

Helping People to Connect

Bronze

Complete an aid request for the first time.

Fairly early in the game, you'll unlock the Aid Request system. This trophy refers to the in-game prepper/facility aid requests from other players. Complete any aid request from the list in the main menu section to unlock this trophy.

Promising Signs

Bronze

Construct an online aid request sign for the first time.

While exploring the world, hold down on the d-pad to open the sign creator. Aid request signs are on the right side of the radial menu. Place any aid request sign this way to unlock this trophy.

My First Structure

Bronze

Build your first structure (any structure - signs, ladders, etc.)

You can literally place a ladder on the ground as soon as you are free to explore. Any structure will unlock this trophy.

Master Builder

Bronze

Build every structure type, including tools, deployable shields, electric traps, and any sign.

Place one of each object in PCC Lv2 (12 items), Sign, Electric Trap, Deployable Shield, Ladder, Climbing Anchor. Make sure you fully build the bridge and safe house .

Starting Point

Bronze

Connect your Q-Pid for the first time.

This will automatically unlock when Sam first uses the Q-Pid.

Keep on Connecting

Silver

Connect all facilities using your Q-Pid

Connect all Preppers/Facilities in Mexico and Australia. There are 42 in total.

Connecting Hearts and Minds

Gold

Maximize your connection level with all facilities.

Reach the five-star connection level with all 42 facilities in DS2.

Self-Improvement

Bronze

Activate an APAS enhancement for the first time.

Use APAS memory to activate your first APAS enhancement – DS2' s version of the skill tree.

It's Like That

Bronze

Send a like for the first time.

You can send a like to any tool, object, vehicle, structure – it makes no difference. You'll unlock this trophy the first time you do it.

A Life Well Liked

Bronze

Receive a total of 2400 or more Likes for completing orders.

This trophy is for completing orders specifically. It should unlock automatically as you continue to deliver orders, receiving Likes each time.

A Porter at Peak Popularity

Bronze

Receive a total of 50,000 or more Likes for completing orders.

Like the previous trophy, simply play through the game. You'll eventually reach 50,000 if you go above and beyond to take care of orders. If you are going for the five-star connection trophy, it will be virtually impossible to miss this trophy.

My First Training Session

Bronze

Complete a VR Training program for the first time.

You can access the VR Training program on the DHV Magellan, as well as in any facility that has a Private Room. You have to complete a program for the first time to unlock this trophy.

A First Glimpse of the SSS

Bronze

Read an SSS post for the first time.

When you receive an SSS notification in the bottom right corner, make sure to either hold the start button, or access the SSS through the main menu. The first time you open the SSS to see a post, you'll unlock this trophy.

Making it Your Own

Bronze

Use a screenshot taken in Photo Mode to decorate your private room.

Any time you use the Photo Mode to take a screenshot (you must take a screenshot in-game by pressing X, not the console's screenshot), it is saved to the SSS. When you enter a Private Room at any facility other than the DHV Magellan, you'll see a large wall with a digital image. If you look straight at the wall, you'll see the option to customize it. Pick a Photo Mode screenshot from the list of available images to unlock the 'Making It Your Own' trophy in DS2.

Creature Comforter

Bronze

Deliver a wild animal to the Animal Shelter. (Animals required to complete orders do not count.)

Once you unlock the Animal Shelter, you'll gain the ability to approach any wild animal, press square to capture them, and return them to the Animal Shelter's sanctuary. You must take the animal all the way to the Animal Shelter. You cannot entrust it to other porters. As noted, you must do this outside of an order.

Rare Specimen Rescuer

Bronze

Deliver an albino animal to the Animal Shelter for the first time.

One option here is to simply keep your eyes open until you see an all-white animal in the wild. However, the best way to capture an albino animal in DS2 is to unlock the Pioneer, then complete his order that tasks Sam with locating and delivering an albino kangaroo to the Animal Shelter.

Road Restorer

Bronze

Restore one section of road

Locate any single Auto-Paver in Death Stranding 2, and provide all required materials. This will unlock the trophy.

Dig, Dig, Dig!

Bronze

Restore three mines.

There are nine mines in Death Stranding 2. Some are large and require far more materials than the smaller mines. The easiest way to complete this trophy quickly is to restore the Smoke Hill Mine when given the option early in Australia, then the Twin Valley Mine east of the F2 South Distribution Center. Then restore one of the large mines, like Mine north of F1 (north of West Fort Knot), or head east and restore the Savanna Mine on the island between the desert area and East Fort Knot.

Rail Restorer

Bronze

Restore and fully open a monorail line.

This requires you to restore every tracklayer along one full monorail line. There are three monorail lines in DS2, with the Northwest Line likely being the easiest to complete. This track runs from West Fort Knot, up to the Mine North of F1, then on to the Mine Near F3 Crater. Luckily, if you've connected the region to the Chiral Network, other players will contribute materials. Another option is to check your map to see which line has the most completed sections.

Emergency Worker

Bronze

Deliver emergency support for the first time.

After a Plate Quake, you'll see that many of the structures in the area have a yellow symbol above them. This denotes a structure that requires emergency aid after being damaged. Supply materials to these structures to repair them, which should unlock this trophy.

Spring into Life

Bronze

Dig a hot spring for the first time.

After you unlock the Hot Spring Digger for the PCC Lv2, you can easily locate a good Hot Spring location by looking for the Hydrologist's aid request to dig a hot spring along the mountain ridge northwest of Heartman's Lab. If you pay close attention to the SSS, you'll also get messages from various preppers who mention the groundwater in the region. Either method is good for completing this trophy.

Written in the Stars

Bronze

Study the night sky for the first time.

To unlock the "Written in the Stars" trophy in DS2, bathe in any hot spring at night. You'll see the option to study the sky among the main list of options while using the spring. Look up at the constellations and enjoy them.

Porters Make the World Go Round

Bronze

Barter with another porter for the first time.

When you encounter any NPC porter in DS2, simply wait for them to offer one of their packages to Sam. Once they do, take it. Then, drop a different item for the NPC porter to pick up. As soon as they do, this trophy will unlock.

A Private Show!

Bronze

Watch a live performance in your private room.

To unlock "A Private Show" in DS2, you must first unlock the music player and the Horizon Dreamer song. Once you have both, enter your Private Room. Turn on Horizon Dreamer, then look at Dollman. He should be dancing to the music. Speak to him, and he will ask if you have a moment. Say yes, and the performance will begin. You'll unlock the trophy at the end of the performance.

So YOU'RE the Pizza Chef!

Bronze

Discover the truth of the Pizza Chef.

To unlock the Pizza Chef trophy in DS2, begin connecting with the Pizza Chef prepper like they were any other. After you reach the 2-Star level, you'll start seeing the Misanga lost cargo . We found it in the Armed Survivalist's camp north of the Pizza Chef while completing Standard Order 107. Return the Misanga to the chef and then watch one of Kojima's greatest cutscenes of all time.

Showdown at the Tar Lake

Silver

Defeat the Lord of the Tar Lake

Once you reach Episode 8, you'll be able to unlock the Fisherman, a prepper who resides on the northern shore of the tar lake near the center of the map. You will have to reach a high connection level with the Fisherman, and eventually he'll send you to take on the Lord of the Tar Lake. Defeat the Lord of the Tar Lake boss to unlock the trophy.

The Headless Riders Unmasked

Bronze

Solve the riddle of the Headless Riders.

To unlock 'The Headless Riders Unmasked' in DS2, you'll first need to establish a connection with the Ghost Hunter. He is found northwest of East Fort Knot. As you increase your connection level, he will ask Sam to help with several investigations. For this investigation, accept the order at The Ghost Hunter's terminal, then head to the quest marker while riding a Tri-Cruiser at night. This will initiate a long encounter, which will end with the trophy being unlocked.

Savior of Terminal Knot

Silver

Prevent Terminal Fort Knot from falling victim to a voidout.

This trophy is unlocked as part of the final investigation for the Ghost Hunter. Before you reach Episode 10, you want to get your connection level with the Ghost Hunter as high as possible. Once you get to the point that only a tiny silver of the fifth star is remaining, and it will not increase, it will be safe to move on and complete the main story. In the post-game, Sam will receive a message on the SSS from the Ghost Hunter asking for his help one final time. This will be the mission that allows you to prevent Terminal Knot City from falling victim to a voidout.

The Scars Left by Giants

Silver

Arrive at the BT nexus in the F3 crater

At the northern edge of the map, you'll see a second massive crater lake that marks the former location of North Fort Knot. The best way to complete this trophy is to wait until you've gained access to the Coffin Board, which allows Sam to ride safely over tar. Once you've reached that point, head out to the edge of the crater. The trophy unlocked for us as soon as we reached the outer rim. If you continue into the center, you'll face a massive fight with two flying BTs.

The Real Story of the Ghost Hunter

Bronze

Reveal the truth about the Ghost Hunter

After you've reached a 5-Star connection with the Ghost Hunter, return to his shelter with the Drawbridge Q-Pid turned on (endgame mechanic). Use the terminal, then listen to Dollman's comments on the subject. This will cause the trophy to unlock.

BT's Best Friend

Bronze

Capture a large BT for the first time.

Use an EX Capture Grenade to capture any large BT in Death Stranding 2. When the BT's health bar turns red, throw the grenade into whatever passes for its mouth. Then pick up the White Crystal that remains.

Conqueror of the Golden BT

Bronze

Defeat the golden chiral creature

There are special golden chiral creatures that can only be found in a few areas on the map. First, you can find them near the tar pits southeast of the Architect. One has been spotted south of the Animal Shelter, and a small group can be found near the South Edge Mine.

A Premier Porter

Silver

Achieve a porter grade of 40 or higher in all categories

Make sure you take the time to utilize both stealth and combat techniques. The other three categories will take care of themselves as you progress through the game. Also, make sure to form all available Bridge Contracts, as it will help the Bridge Link category.

Compulsive Cargo Carrier

Bronze

Deliver a total of 500 pieces of cargo.

This is another trophy that simply requires you to progress through the game. You can actively try to pick up orders with high cargo counts, but you really don't have to if you are working towards the Platinum trophy. You'll easily hit 500 pieces while going for 5-Star connection levels with every facility.

Heavy Lifter

Bronze

Deliver cargo weighing a total of two tons.

Load up as much cargo as you can, as many times as you can, and you'll easily unlock this trophy.

Long-Distance Lugger

Bronze

Reach a total distance traveled of 80km upon the completion of an order.

A good way to unlock this trophy is to pick an extremely long order, then several small orders that can be delivered along the way. If done correctly, you'll be able to cover 80km in a single go.

This represents all 55 trophies in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach.

Death Stranding 2: On the Beach
9.3 /10
Released
June 26, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Violence, Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Kojima Productions
Publisher(s)
Sony Interactive Entertainment
Engine
Decima
Franchise
Death Stranding
Number of Players
Single-player
PS5 Release Date
June 26, 2025
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5
Powered by

item.title: Death Stranding 2: 8 Strongest BTs To Catch, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • BTs in Death Stranding 2 can be captured using EX Capture Grenades once weakened.
  • Different BTs in the game have unique abilities and can be found in specific locations.
  • Capturing BTs like Gigas, Cetus, and Octopoid can provide different advantages in battles.

Hideo Kojima's latest game has a lot of mechanics that don't unlock until players are deep into the experience. This includes the ability to catch BTs in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach . BTs serve as the majority of the game's bosses, and even though they may appear too big to become allies, they are not.

Nearly every large BT in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach can be captured using the EX Capture Grenade, which can be acquired in the story. There are no upgrades for this grenade, either. Players just need to weaken a BT, throw an EX Capture Grenade into their mouth, and that should do the trick. These are the strongest and most useful BT players that can be found and captured in Death Stranding 2, and they will be ranked accordingly.

Spoilers Ahead for Death Stranding 2: On The Beach.

8 BT Crystal (Delphis)

Your First BT

  • Location : Mexico (Near Former Geophysical Research Lab)

The Delphis BT will be the first boss players will encounter, just outside of the Former Geophysical Research Lab in Mexico. It looks like a small whale, but it won’t put up too much of a fight. It will appear outside of this lab for the most part if players ever need to capture it.

It’s a fine, easy BT to capture that is okay for support, but it is nowhere near as strong as the other whale-like BT in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach .

7 BT Crystal (Bestia)

The Roar Of A Lion

  • Location : Australia (Near F5 East Distribution Center)

The Bestia BT looks like a lion if its head were sunken in and it had a mane made of tentacles. They are agile and appear in groups, but captured Bestia BTs will only operate solo, unfortunately.

They can be found near the F5 East Distribution Center, and their key power comes from their laser vision. While their laser power and speed are nice, the Bestia does have limitations in terms of its size.

6 BT Crystal (Megalocarcinus)

Giant Enemy Crabs

  • Location : Mexico (Story Battle)

The Megalocarcinus BT is the final BT boss fight that Sam will fight on his own in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach during the story. It will appear on the way to Sam’s bunker in Mexico, and it resembles a towering, spider-like crab.

Catching this BT can be tricky, as players must knock out all of its legs to lower its head closer to the ground. If players can’t capture it here, there is a large tar-covered crater that will randomly spawn BTs that players have already faced. While the Megalocarcinus BT is cool-looking, its massive size is almost too big to be helpful in battle unless players plan to fight other Kaiju-level monstrosities and create their own Godzilla movie within Death Stranding 2: On the Beach .

5 BT Crystal (Gigas)

Attack On Titan

  • Location : Australia (The Ghost Hunter Quest)

The Gigas BT will is a giant entity encountered during the game’s final battle, but Sam will not face one. Players can force Sam to fight a Gigas for the Ghost Hunter, though, during his Sub Order 114, which requires maxing out some Connection levels in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach .

While powerful, the Gigas’ giant body will give it some trouble when attacking enemies on the ground, which makes it more ideal for facing BTs like the Megalocarcinus.

4 BT Crystal (Cetus)

A Whale Of A BT

  • Location : Australia (The Fisherman Quest)

The Cetus BT is also tied to a Sub Order in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , which is part of the Fisherman’s series of quests. Sub Order 117 requires players to capture a Delphis and then release it in the tar-covered lake outside of the Fisherman’s abode. Only then will the Cetus appear, aka. The Lord of the Lake.

While it is massive in size, it is still quite fast, plus it can dive into the tar and disappear. This immediately makes it stronger than the Gigas and Megalocarcinus BTs.

3 BT Crystal (Octopoid)

More Tentacles Than You Can Handle

  • Location : Australia (Near The Fisherman)

The Octopoid BT can also be encountered near the Fisherman's place, but it doesn’t require a quest to make it appear. It’s a smaller BT that resembles an octopus and features large tentacles that can trip up enemies.

Taking it down and capturing it won’t be that hard, which is funny considering it is one of the strongest BTs in the game. Even against a pack of Bestia BTs, the Octopoid can hold its own in a fight and still have plenty of gusto left over.

2 BT Crystal (Kheir)

High Five Hand Slaps

  • Location : Mexico (Near C1 South Distribution Center)

There are a lot of themes in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach , from characters with dual identities to stick vs. rope debates to hands. Lots of hands. The Kheir BT is a creature that resembles a blend of a hand and a spider, creating something truly horrific, on par with Elden Ring's Mother of Fingers.

Kheir can be encountered near the C1 South Distribution Center in Mexico. These BTs can punch, spray fire, or shoot lasers from every fingertip, making it the most well-rounded BT on the market in terms of its skill set.

1 BT Crystal (Raia)

Death From Above

  • Location : Australia (The Government Base)

The Raia BT is one of the hardest creatures to capture, and players may throw up their hands in frustration trying to do so. This is the only pure-flying BT in the game, and it looks like a manta ray.

Battles can end abruptly if it sucks Sam up like a UFO tractor beam, and it’s hard to throw the EX Capture Grenade into its mouth from the ground. However players manage to pull it off, the Raia is a must-have BT to call in some air support during battles outside of the DHV Magellan’s later weaponry.

24 Images
24 Images

item.title: Roblox: Goalbound Codes (July 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Goalbound Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes for Goalbound
  • How to Get More Goalbound Codes

There are plenty of great soccer games on Roblox , but Goalbound is arguably one of the best around. Inspired by the Blue Lock anime, it offers high-stakes, ego-driven gameplay and a wide range of flashy abilities through which players can showcase and show off their skills.

Roblox players who want to further enhance their experience should be on the lookout for Goalbound codes, as these can be used to get free regular and lucky spins. Below, they'll find a list of all of the working codes, as well as step-by-step instructions on how to redeem them.

All Goalbound Codes

Working Goalbound Codes

  • RELEASE - Redeem code for 5 Spins and 3 Lucky Spins (NEW)
  • DELAYBOUND - Redeem code for 10 Spins and 5 Lucky Spins (NEW)

Expired Goalbound Codes

  • PLAYTEST! - Redeem code for 5 Spins and 5 Lucky Spins

How to Redeem Codes for Goalbound

Redeeming codes in Goalbound is a little bit more complicated than it is in similar Roblox experiences, as players will first need to join the Goalbound group and like the game on Roblox ​​​​​​. After doing so, though, they'll be free to click on the envelope button at the top of the screen to bring up the code redemption window as normal. It's then just a simple case of typing or pasting one of the working Goalbound codes from the list above into the green box and pressing the Redeem button to claim your rewards.

  1. Join the official ΞGO Roblox Community.
  2. Like the game on Roblox .
  3. Launch Goalbound .
  4. Press the envelope button at the top of the screen.
  5. Type or paste a Goalbound code into the green box.
  6. Press the Redeem button.

How to Get More Goalbound Codes

As always, the best place to get more Goalbound codes is right here, as we're always on the lookout for new Roblox promo codes and will add any that we find to the list above. That said, it's also a good idea to join the game's official Discord server, as new codes are often revealed there before anywhere else.

  • Official Goalbound Discord Server
  • Official ΞGO Roblox Community

item.title: 7 Best Monster Reveals In Horror Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • A monster's terrifying introduction sets the tone for horror games, leaving a lasting impression.
  • Iconic horror antagonists are slowly unveiled, building suspense and fear for players.
  • From eerie reveals like The Janitor in Little Nightmares to shocking surprises like the Giant Baby in Resident Evil Village , monster intros are crucial.

Making a good first impression isn't just important on dates; monsters need to be on their best (or worst) behavior too. A terrifying monster is only as strong as its introduction . Every good villain, monster, or killer needs an iconic first scene where every grotesque detail of their character design gets a chance to shine. Some monster reveals are sudden and shocking, while others are slow and agonizing.

Some antagonists may deliver their first "Hello" by violently slaughtering a side character, while others may take a more subtle approach, lurking in the background as the protagonist wanders by, blissfully unaware of their presence. A successful and iconic horror antagonist makes their first scene impactful and leaves a lasting impression. Here are some of the best monster reveals in the world of horror games.

7 The Janitor

Little Nightmares

Little Nightmares
8 /10
8.8 /10
Released
April 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Violence
Powered by

The Janitor, who patrols The Maw, is the very first boss the player meets in Little Nightmares . The Janitor is known for his freakishly long arms and makes a lasting impression from the moment the player sees him dragging a cage as they guide Six through the Depths. What makes The Janitor's reveal so eerie is how he is slowly introduced. The first few times the player encounters him, he is far in the distance, posing no threat and not close enough for the player to make out what this strange creature truly looks like.

However, as the player continues through The Maw, the Janitor slowly gets closer and closer, until he finally takes notice of Six, forcing her to run for her life.

6 The First Necromorphs

Dead Space

Dead Space (2023)
9 /10
13
8.4 /10
Released
January 27, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Rated M for Mature for Blood and Gore, Strong Language, and Intense Violence.
Powered by

Dead Space may seem like the type of game to take things slow at the beginning, as it sets the scene with protagonist Isaac and his crew making their way to the USG Ishimura . However, that moment of peace Isaac has is interrupted very quickly the moment the crew realizes that the Ishimura is completely infested with vicious monsters known as necromorphs .

The moment Isaac is separated from the rest of his crewmates and is forced to watch them get torn apart on the other side of the glass is one of the most terrifying introductions to a video game in recent horror game history. The relentless advance of the necromorphs doesn't stop there, but their first appearance makes it clear how deadly they are.

5 Abstract Daddy

Silent Hill 2 Remake

Silent Hill 2
9 /10
69
9.1 /10
Released
October 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

One of the most terrifying aspects of the Abstract Daddy boss fight in the remake of Silent Hill 2 is the confusion that players face the moment they see the monster for the first time. As James faces Angela, the camera focuses on poor Angela's terror as she points to something looming behind James. Suddenly, this disgusting monstrosity charges at him and pins him to the wall, making it clear this is no longer just Angela's fight, but James' too.

Players aren't given any time to adjust or assess their surroundings. There's no time to grimace over the horrible monster's appearance; their only choice is to run and find some way to defend themselves. While the Abstract Daddy is unnerving just from his initial appearance, it's the horrific truth behind what his appearance symbolizes that makes him one of the most despicable monsters in the world of Silent Hill .

4 The Baby

Resident Evil Village

Resident Evil Village
8 /10
24
9.0 /10
Released
May 7, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Similar to RE7 's "Happy Birthday Tape" sequence that played out like an escape room, House Beneviento was also mainly a place for Ethan to focus on solving riddles as a well-deserved break from all the Lycan and vampire combat in Resident Evil Village . However, just when players think they've found their way out of the basement, they're faced with one of RE 's most terrifying monsters: The Baby . As the player runs towards the exit, thinking they're home free, the dark hallway slowly uncovers a disgusting, fleshy mass of a creature turning the corner, heading right for them.

While the official name of this creature is simply "The Baby," this grotesque, deformed baby is far from small and adorable, and will even swallow poor Ethan whole if caught. There is no fighting The Baby; Ethan needs to hide, wait for it to slide past, and then run for his life.

3 Laura

The Evil Within

The Evil Within
5 /10
7.8 /10
Released
October 14, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Laura is one of the antagonists of The Evil Within and ensures that she leaves a lasting impression on players from the first moment she appears. The first time players encounter Laura is at the end of the game's fourth chapter, in a morgue-like room.

At the end of the hall is a bloody mess, and a corpse that the player can't make heads or tails of. However, as the player approaches, Laura suddenly emerges from the bloody aftermath, her giant limbs sprouting out of the bloodied body, pulling out the rest of her as the player has no choice but to run (or fight).

2 The Rat King

The Last Of Us Part 2

The Last of Us Part 2
10 /10
12
7.3 /10
Released
June 19, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Fans of The Last of Us know how much of a threat the infected can be. What could be more terrifying than clickers, stalkers, and bloaters? All of them rolled into one, of course. The Rat King is the name given to the unique monster lurking in the depths of the hospital, a disgusting amalgamation of the first infected victims in Seattle, marking a 25-year "project" of infection and mutation.

Players first encounter the elusive Rat King when playing as Abby in The Last of Us Part 2 as she searches for supplies in a derelict ambulance. As Abby hears low growls and grumbles, the Rat King suddenly appears at the ambulance's rear door, Abby's flashlight giving the mutated monster the center stage as it makes its first appearance and drags her (literally) into a fight for her life.

1 The Very First Zombie

Resident Evil

8 Images
8 Images
Resident Evil
9.4 /10
Released
March 22, 1996

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Language, Violence
Powered by

The Resident Evil series has long reigned as one of the most iconic zombie series of all time. While players all know the dreadful feeling of being surrounded by hordes of zombies and lickers, it all began with one iconic moment. The classic RE cutscene where the player encounters the very first zombie remains one of the most terrifying monster reveals ever.

The zombie that's eating poor S.T.A.R.S. member Kenneth does a slow, agonizing turn towards the camera, making for one of the most terrifying moments in gaming history. The infamous zombie was lovingly named "Turning Around Zombie" or "TAZ" for short by the RE community, cementing its iconic status among RE fans.

item.title: Pokemon GO Announces New July Max Battle Day
item.description:
Pokemon GO has revealed that a new Max Battle Day featuring Lapras will take place on July 19. That will be another opportunity for Pokemon GO players to catch the Gigantamax form of the Kanto pocket monster that Niantic added in 2024.

Lapras is one of the critters available since Pokemon GO 's release. Its regular form has appeared frequently in events over the years, including the 2021 editions of Pokemon GO Tour: Kanto and Pokemon GO Fest. Shiny Lapras was added in 2019 at the start of the Safari Zone in Sentosa, while the Shadow variant debuted in 2019 at the Halloween event. Next was the shiny form of Shadow Lapras, added in 2020 at the Team GO Rocket event, while Gigantamax Lapras appeared in the game for the first time in 2024. Now, Pokemon GO players will encounter the Water/Ice-type critter once again soon.

Pokemon GO has announced a Max Battle Day featuring Gigantamax Lapras. The event will take place on Saturday, July 19, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time. During this period, the Kanto Pokemon will appear in Max Battles, with players having the chance to encounter a shiny one. Seven bonuses will be available during the Max Battle Day, including the Max Particle collection limit increased to 1,600, and the possibility of making two additional Special Trades. As with previous events, the Remote Raid Pass limit will be increased to 20 from Friday, July 18, at 5 pm to Saturday, July 19, 2025, at 8 pm PT.

Gigantamax Lapras Returns to Pokemon GO in New Max Battle Day

  • Date: Saturday, July 19, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time
  • Featured Pokemon: Gigantamax Lapras (can be shiny)
  • Event Bonuses
    • Remote Raid Pass limit increased to 20 from Friday, July 18, at 5 pm to Saturday, July 19, 2025, at 8 pm PT
    • Max Particle collection limit increased to 1,600
    • 1/4 Adventuring distance to receive Max Particles*^
    • 2× Max Particles from exploring^
    • Power Spots will refresh more frequently
    • 8× Max Particles from Power Spots
    • Two additional Special Trades can be made.

  • *For this bonus to apply, Trainers must first collect all Max Particles available in the Nearby menu. Trainers can collect Max Particles via the Nearby menu each day by exploring.
  • ^While most bonuses are only active during the three-hour event period, these will be active from 12 am to 5 pm local time.
  • Free Timed Research
    • Available starting on: Monday, July 14, 2025, at 6 am local time.

  • Rewards
    • Dynamax Passimian encounter
    • Passimian Candy
    • Max Particles
    • And more

  • The tasks associated with this Timed Research must be completed and their rewards must be claimed before Saturday, July 19, 2025, at 5 pm local time.
  • Event Ticket (Gives a Timed Research)
    • Price: $4.99
      • Timed Research Rewards include
        • 1 Max Mushroom
        • 25,000 XP
        • 2× XP from Max Battles (bonus)
        • Max Particle collection limit increased to 5,600 (bonus)

  • This Timed Research will be effective on Saturday, July 19, 2025, from 2 pm to 5 pm local time.
  • Pokemon GO Web Store Offers
  • Gigantamax Lapras Max Battle Day Ultra Ticket Box
    • Price: $4.99
    • Includes: an event ticket and a bonus Max Particle Pack

  • Max Battle Boost Box
    • Price: $7.99
    • Includes: a Max Mushroom and seven Max Particle Packs

In addition to the bonuses, new Timed Research will be available starting Monday, July 14, 2025, at 6 am local time. Upon completing this Special Research, Pokemon GO players will encounter a Dynamax Passimian and receive rewards including Passimian Candy and Max Particles. Players should be aware, however, that this Timed Research and its rewards will expire on Saturday, July 19, 2025, at 5 pm local time. To help boost trainers' progress, a $4.99 ticket will be available in-game, and the Pokemon GO Web Store will sell two boxes—one for $4.99 and another for $7.99.

This Max Battle Day is an opportunity that players won't want to miss, as it's the first time Gigantamax Lapras has appeared since its Pokemon GO debut. Following this event, the game's July activity calendar promises other moments to keep Pokemon GO players engaged, such as the debut of Tatsugiri on July 15 and the additions of Honedge, Doublade, and Aegislash on July 22.
